hcloud-datasource-datacenter.body:
data "hcloud_datacenter" "$1" {
    # id - (Optional) (Optional, string) ID of the datacenter.
    id = ""

    # name - (Optional) (Optional, string) Name of the datacenter.
    name = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - (int) Unique ID of the datacenter.
    # "name" - (string) Name of the datacenter.
    # "description" - (string) Description of the datacenter.
    # "location" - (map) Physical datacenter location.
    # "supported_server_type_ids" - (list) List of server types supported by the datacenter.
    # "available_server_type_ids" - (list) List of available server types.
}
hcloud-datasource-datacenter.description:
Provides details about a specific Hetzner Cloud Datacenter.
Use this resource to get detailed information about specific datacenter.

hcloud-datasource-datacenters.description:
Provides a list of available Hetzner Cloud Datacenters.
This resource may be useful to create highly available infrastructure, distributed across several datacenters.

hcloud-datasource-floating-ip.body:
data "hcloud_floating_ip" "$1" {
    # ip_address - (Optional) (Optional, string) IP address of the Floating IP.
    ip_address = ""

    # selector - (Optional) (Optional, string) [Label selector](https://docs.hetzner.cloud/#overview-label-selector)
    selector = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - (int) Unique ID of the Floating IP.
    # "ip_address" - (string) IP address of the Floating IP.
}
hcloud-datasource-floating-ip.description:
Provides details about a Hetzner Cloud Floating IP.
This resource can be useful when you need to determine a Floating IP ID based on the IP address.

hcloud-datasource-image.body:
data "hcloud_image" "$1" {
    # id - (Optional) (Optional, string) ID of the Image.
    id = ""

    # name - (Optional) (Optional, string) Name of the Image.
    name = ""

    # selector - (Optional) (Optional, string) [Label selector](https://docs.hetzner.cloud/#overview-label-selector)
    selector = ""

    # most_recent - (Optional) (Optional, bool) If more than one result is returned, use the most recent Image.
    most_recent = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - (int) Unique ID of the Image.
    # "name" - (string) Name of the Image.
    # "type" - (string) Type of the Image, could be "system", "backup" or "snapshot".
    # "status" - (string) Status of the Image.
    # "description" - (string) Description of the Image.
    # "created" - (string) Date when the Image was created (in ISO-8601 format).
    # "os_flavor" - (string) Flavor of operating system contained in the image, could be "ubuntu", "centos", "debian", "fedora" or "unknown".
    # "os_version" - (string) Operating system version.
    # "rapid_deploy" - (bool) Indicates that rapid deploy of the image is available.
    # "deprecated" - (string) Point in time when the image is considered to be deprecated (in ISO-8601 format).
}
hcloud-datasource-image.description:
Provides details about a Hetzner Cloud Image.
This resource is useful if you want to use a non-terraform managed image.

hcloud-datasource-location.body:
data "hcloud_location" "$1" {
    # id - (Optional) (Optional, string) ID of the location.
    id = ""

    # name - (Optional) (Optional, string) Name of the location.
    name = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - (int) Unique ID of the location.
    # "name" - (string) Name of the location.
    # "description" - (string) Description of the location.
    # "city" - (string) City of the location.
    # "country" - (string) Country of the location.
    # "latitude" - (float) Latitude of the city.
    # "longitude" - (float) Longitude of the city.
}
hcloud-datasource-location.description:
Provides details about a specific Hetzner Cloud Location.
Use this resource to get detailed information about specific location.

hcloud-datasource-locations.description:
Provides a list of available Hetzner Cloud Locations.
This resource may be useful to create highly available infrastructure, distributed across several locations.

hcloud-datasource-ssh-key.body:
data "hcloud_ssh_key" "$1" {
    # id - (Optional) (Optional, string) ID of the SSH Key.
    id = ""

    # name - (Optional) (Optional, string) Name of the SSH Key.
    name = ""

    # fingerprint - (Optional) (Optional, string) Fingerprint of the SSH Key.
    fingerprint = ""

    # selector - (Optional) (Optional, string) [Label selector](https://docs.hetzner.cloud/#overview-label-selector)
    selector = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - (int) Unique ID of the SSH Key.
    # "name" - (string) Name of the SSH Key.
    # "fingerprint" - (string) Fingerprint of the SSH Key.
    # "public_key" - (string) Public Key of the SSH Key.
}
hcloud-datasource-ssh-key.description:
Provides details about a Hetzner Cloud SSH Key.
This resource is useful if you want to use a non-terraform managed SSH Key.

hcloud-datasource-volume.body:
data "hcloud_volume" "$1" {
    # id - (Optional) ID of the volume.
    id = ""

    # name - (Optional) Name of the volume.
    name = ""

    # selector - (Optional) Label Selector. For more information about possible values, visit the [Hetzner Cloud Documentation](https://docs.hetzner.cloud/#overview-label-selector).
    selector = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - Unique ID of the volume.
    # "name" - Name of the volume.
    # "size" - Size of the volume.
}
hcloud-datasource-volume.description:
Provides details about a Hetzner Cloud volume.
This resource is useful if you want to use a non-terraform managed volume.

hcloud-resource-floating-ip-assignment.body:
resource "hcloud_floating_ip_assignment" "$1" {
    # floating_ip_id - (Optional) (Required, int) ID of the Floating IP.
    floating_ip_id = ""

    # server_id - (Optional) (Required, int) Server to assign the Floating IP to.
    server_id = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - (int) Unique ID of the Floating IP Assignment.
    # "floating_ip_id" - (int) ID of the Floating IP.
    # "server_id" - (int) Server the Floating IP was assigned to.
}
hcloud-resource-floating-ip-assignment.description: Provides a Hetzner Cloud Floating IP Assignment to assign a Floating IP to a Hetzner Cloud Server. Deleting a Floating IP Assignment will unassign the Floating IP from the Server.

hcloud-resource-floating-ip-x.body:
resource "hcloud_floating_ip" "$1" {
    # type - (Optional) (Required, string) Type of the Floating IP. `ipv4` `ipv6`
    type = ""

    # server_id - (Optional) (Optional, int) Server to assign the Floating IP to.
    server_id = ""

    # home_location - (Optional) (Optional, string) Home location (routing is optimized for that location). Optional if server_id argument is passed.
    home_location = ""

    # description - (Optional) (Optional, string) Description of the Floating IP.
    description = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - (int) Unique ID of the Floating IP.
    # "type" - (string) Type of the Floating IP.
    # "server_id" - (int) Server to assign the Floating IP is assigned to.
    # "home_location" - (string) Home location.
    # "description" - (string) Description of the Floating IP.
    # "ip_address" - (string) IP Address of the Floating IP.
    # "ip_network" - (string) IPv6 subnet. (Only set if "type" is "ipv6")
    # "labels" - (map) User-defined labels (key-value pairs)
}
hcloud-resource-floating-ip-x.description: Provides a Hetzner Cloud Floating IP to represent a publicly-accessible static IP address that can be mapped to one of your servers.

hcloud-resource-rdns.body:
resource "hcloud_rdns" "$1" {
    # dns_ptr - (Optional) (Required, string) The DNS address the `ip_address` should resolve to.
    dns_ptr = ""

    # ip_address - (Optional) (Required, string) The IP address that should point to `dns_ptr`.
    ip_address = ""

    # server_id - (Optional) (Required, int) The server the `ip_address` belongs to.
    server_id = ""

    # floating_ip_id - (Optional) (Required, int) The Floating IP the `ip_address` belongs to.
    floating_ip_id = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - (int) Unique ID of the Reverse DNS Entry.
    # "dns_ptr" - (string) DNS pointer for the IP address.
    # "ip_address" - (string) IP address.
    # "server_id" - (int) The server the IP address belongs to.
    # "floating_ip_id" - (int) The Floating IP the IP address belongs to.
}
hcloud-resource-rdns.description: Provides a Hetzner Cloud Reverse DNS Entry to create, modify and reset reverse dns entries for Hetzner Cloud Floating IPs or servers.

hcloud-resource-server.body:
resource "hcloud_server" "$1" {
    # name - (Optional) (Required, string) Name of the server to create (must be unique per project and a valid hostname as per RFC 1123).
    name = ""

    # server_type - (Optional) (Required, string) Name of the server type this server should be created with.
    server_type = ""

    # image - (Optional) (Required, string) Name or ID of the image the server is created from.
    image = ""

    # location - (Optional) (Optional, string) The location name to create the server in. `nbg1`, `fsn1` or `hel1`
    location = ""

    # datacenter - (Optional) (Optional, string) The datacenter name to create the server in.
    datacenter = ""

    # user_data - (Optional) (Optional, string) Cloud-Init user data to use during server creation
    user_data = ""

    # ssh_keys - (Optional) (Optional, list) SSH key IDs or names which should be injected into the server at creation time
    ssh_keys = ""

    # keep_disk - (Optional) (Optional, bool) If true, do not upgrade the disk. This allows downgrading the server type later.
    keep_disk = ""

    # iso - (Optional) (Optional, string) Name of an ISO image to mount.
    iso = ""

    # rescue - (Optional) (Optional, string) Enable and boot in to the specified rescue system. This enables simple installation of custom operating systems. `linux64` `linux32` or `freebsd64`
    rescue = ""

    # labels - (Optional) (Optional, map) User-defined labels (key-value pairs) should be created with.
    labels = ""

    # backups - (Optional) (Optional, boolean) Enable or disable backups.
    backups = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - (int) Unique ID of the server.
    # "name" - (string) Name of the server.
    # "server_type" - (string) Name of the server type.
    # "image" - (string) Name or ID of the image the server was created from.
    # "location" - (string) The location name.
    # "datacenter" - (string) The datacenter name.
    # "backup_window" - (string) The backup window of the server, if enabled.
    # "backups" - (boolean) Whether backups are enabled.
    # "iso" - (string) Name of the mounted ISO image.
    # "ipv4_address" - (string) The IPv4 address.
    # "ipv6_address" - (string) The first IPv6 address of the assigned network.
    # "ipv6_network" - (string) The IPv6 network.
    # "status" - (string) The status of the server.
    # "labels" - (map) User-defined labels (key-value pairs)
}
hcloud-resource-server.description: Provides an Hetzner Cloud server resource. This can be used to create, modify, and delete servers. Servers also support [provisioning](https://www.terraform.io/docs/provisioners/index.html).

hcloud-resource-ssh-key.body:
resource "hcloud_ssh_key" "$1" {
    # name - (Optional) (Required, string) Name of the SSH key.
    name = ""

    # public_key - (Optional) (Required, string) The public key. If this is a file, it can be read using the file interpolation function
    public_key = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - (int) The unique ID of the key.
    # "name" - (string) The name of the SSH key
    # "public_key" - (string) The text of the public key
    # "fingerprint" - (string) The fingerprint of the SSH key
    # "labels" - (map) User-defined labels (key-value pairs)
}
hcloud-resource-ssh-key.description: Provides a Hetzner Cloud SSH key resource to manage SSH keys for server access.

hcloud-resource-volume-attachment.body:
resource "hcloud_volume_attachment" "$1" {
    # volume_id - (Optional) (Required, int) ID of the Volume.
    volume_id = ""

    # server_id - (Optional) (Required, int) Server to attach the Volume to.
    server_id = ""

    # automount - (Optional) (Optional, bool) Automount the volume upon attaching it.
    automount = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - (int) Unique ID of the Volume Attachment.
    # "volume_id" - (int) ID of the Volume.
    # "server_id" - (int) Server the Volume was attached to.
}
hcloud-resource-volume-attachment.description: Provides a Hetzner Cloud Volume attachment to attach a Volume to a Hetzner Cloud Server. Deleting a Volume Attachment will detach the Volume from the Server.

hcloud-resource-volume-x.body:
resource "hcloud_volume" "$1" {
    # name - (Optional) (Required, string) Name of the volume to create (must be unique per project).
    name = ""

    # size - (Optional) (Required, int) Size of the volume (in GB).
    size = ""

    # server - (Optional) (Optional, int) Server to attach the Volume to, optional if location argument is passed.
    server = ""

    # location - (Optional) (Optional, string) Location of the volume to create, optional if server_id argument is passed.
    location = ""

    # automount - (Optional) (Optional, bool) Automount the volume upon attaching it (server_id must be provided).
    automount = ""

    # format - (Optional) (Optional, string) Format volume after creation. `xfs` or `ext4`
    format = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - Unique ID of the volume.
    # "name" - Name of the volume.
    # "size" - Size of the volume.
    # "labels" - User-defined labels (key-value pairs).
    # "linux_device" - 	Device path on the file system for the Volume.
}
hcloud-resource-volume-x.description: Provides a Hetzner Cloud volume resource to manage volumes.
